headline: Jim Cramer says this is the easiest way for the market to get out of its tariff 'nightmare'
summary: The "Mad Money" host said the uncertain legal fight over Trump's tariffs could eventually deliver a positive outcome for the market.

headline: Ulta Beauty is warning about consumer ’uncertainty.’ It still nudged its forecast higher.
summary: Shares of Ulta Beauty rallied after hours on Thursday as the cosmetics retailer grew slightly more upbeat on the year ahead — while still warning its outlook reflected “uncertainty around how consumer demand could evolve” amid concerns over tariffs and inflation.

headline: Trump’s spending bill comes with huge costs that many voters don’t seem to understand
summary: Voters want to curb the deficit and extend Trump’s tax cuts. They can’t have both.

headline: Marvell meets earnings expectations, but here’s what’s really on investors’ minds
summary: Investors will be looking for more information about the company’s Amazon relationship, which has been a hot topic on Wall Street as Marvell’s stock has struggled this year.

headline: Gap’s sales stall, and retailer puts a number to additional costs due to tariffs
summary: Gap Inc.’s stock drops after the retailer called for flat current-quarter sales.

headline: Dell’s earnings outlook blows past expectations, and this number explains why
summary: Dell’s stock is rising after the company announced a $14 billion-plus AI backlog and said it expects to ship $7 billion worth of AI servers this quarter.

headline: Costco tops earnings and revenue estimates as sales jump 8%
summary: Costco is poised to benefit from tariff volatility as it offers competitive prices and bulk discounts.

headline: Here’s what investors should do as courts deliberate the future of Trump’s tariffs
summary: The stock market is back to where it started the year, but investors should remember that the economy is looking weaker.

headline: The market got an expected boost from Nvidia — though traders mispriced the stock’s options again
summary: Traders have been overly optimistic about Nvidia’s post-earnings moves. The S&P 500’s potential is much clearer.

headline: Turkey, nuts and Spam are appealing to ‘strained’ consumers, Hormel says
summary: The meat and snack company says its products seen as offering more value will drive an uptick in business in the second half of the year.
